events.name: The Maker is In
events.description: Join Makers Anjali Venkat and Gabriel Perumal these three weeks, Monday to Friday, from 1pm to 6pm. Drop in for a chat, collaborate in special projects and learn from the Makers.

events.name: Front End TL;DR
events.description: Happy new year! To kick off 2016 we're being hosted by the brand new ST Innovation Lab. Come learn together and meet the tech team that's changing news in Singapore. Address: The Straits Times Newsroom Level 2, SPH News Centre, 1000 Toa Payoh North Have you ever come across something new in front end, had the browser tab open for weeks, but never found time to research it? Use this event as an excuse to dig a little deeper. Front End TL;DR is a learning event where everyone participates. Helps to bring a laptop. Join to level-up your front-end knowledge, meet other front-end developers, or learn how the engineers at the venue host ship code. 7:00pm — Arrival, seating, food & drinks  7:15pm — Intro talk by the host  7:30pm — R&D: random team assignment, choose a topic, learn something new  9:00pm — Q&A: share what your team learned  9:30–10:00pm — The end. There should be guest wifi. Food & drinks sometimes provided (ymmv). Every third Monday of the month. Different venue each time. More info: http://feds.strikingly.com/
events.location: SPH News Centre, 1000 Toa Payoh North, Singapore

events.name: WordPress Singapore (Jan 2016)
events.description:
It's the new year. Time for another meetup! 



• Implementing SSL via Let's Encrypt on your serversRobert SimExperience level: Intermediate • Using Custom Post TypesJon AngExperience level: Intermediate • Community Open Space: bring your WordPress questions and let the community help you with it! 



We're looking for lightning talks! Please let us know if you're interested in speaking. We're always looking for speakers and volunteers to help with our meetups! Please contact Valentine, Jon or Robert if you're interested in helping out.
events.location: Hackerspace.SG, 344B King George's Ave, King George's Building, Singapore

events.name: PyLadies SG January Meetup: Python 101 Workshop
events.description:
This is a re-run of our December Python 101 workshop.

If you have never used Python before, this workshop is for you!

If you have been to the last Python 101 workshop and you would  like to see it again, you can, of course, come again!

It is very hands-on, so please install Python 2.7, the free atom.io editor and bring your laptop.

We will learn about the basic Python syntax, like variables, strings, lists, dictionaries, if-statements, loops and functions. If all this sounds scary to you, then YOU NEED TO COME AND SEE THIS!

We will take turns writing code to make sure that everyone actually gets to write a little bit of code and at the end of the day we will have built our first tiny little Python program that does something useful.
events.location: 5 Temasek Boulevard, Level 7, Suntec Tower 5, Singapore 038985
